Interface VaultRunner

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultVaultRunner

    public interface VaultRunner

    • Method Detail

      • runInVault0

        VaultOutput runInVault0(java.util.List<java.net.URL> paths,
                        java.lang.String runnableClass)
                 throws VaultException
        Run code in a controlled environment. The input is a directory containing one or more class files (or packages of class files) and a main method to be invoked. Example: 
           vaultRunner.runInVault0(Lists.newArrayList(evilCodeDirectory), "somepackage.SomeClass")
        Parameters:
        paths - Directories containing class files
        runnableClass - Main class to run
        Returns:
        The output result, system out and system error
        Throws:
        VaultException
        See Also:
        runInVault0(List, String), runInVault0(String, String), runInVault0(Runnable), runInVault0(String)

      • runInVault0

        VaultOutput runInVault0(java.lang.String className,
                        java.lang.String source)
                 throws VaultException
        Run code in a controlled environment. The input is a class name and the source code for the class Example: 
           vaultRunner.runInVault0("SomeClass", "System.out.println(\"Hello world\");")
        Parameters:
        className - The name of the class
        source - The source of the class
        Returns:
        The output result, system out and system error
        Throws:
        VaultException
        See Also:
        runInVault0(List, String), runInVault0(String, String), runInVault0(Runnable), runInVault0(String)

      • runInVault0

        VaultOutput runInVault0(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
                 throws VaultException
        Run code in a controlled environment. The input is a Runnable class. Example: 
           vaultRunner.runInVault0(myRunnable)
        Parameters:
        runnable - A Runnable class
        Returns:
        The output result, system out and system error
        Throws:
        VaultException
        See Also:
        runInVault0(List, String), runInVault0(String, String), runInVault0(Runnable), runInVault0(String)

      • runInVault0

        VaultOutput runInVault0(java.lang.String snippet)
                 throws VaultException
        Run code in a controlled environment. The input is a snippet (code without wrapping class) Example: 
           vaultRunner.runInVault0("System.out.println(\"Hello world\");")
        Parameters:
        snippet -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        VaultException
        See Also:
        runInVault0(List, String), runInVault0(String, String), runInVault0(Runnable), runInVault0(String)
